契.definition: to carve; carved words; to agree; a contract; a deed

契丹.definition: Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]

契丹國志.definition: History of the Liao Dynasty, 13th-century book on the history of the Khitan Empire (916-1125)

契卡.definition: Cheka, a Soviet secret police agency, forerunner of the KGB

契合.definition: agreement; to agree; to get on with; congenial; agreeing with; to ally oneself with sb

契箭.definition: arrow used as a token of authority (by field commanders)

契訶夫.definition: Anton Pavlovich Chekhov (1860-1904), Russian writer famous for his short stories and plays
